quote: Some people are really nice about it. I get Saudi princes and famous people stopping me in L.A. and saying, 'You're Stifler's mom. Can I take a picture with you?' But then you get people like her putting their camera in your face without asking. They think they can do whatever they like.
author: Jennifer Coolidge

quote: It's hard to make a living in this business. Unions aren't as strong as they used to be. For a journeyman actor - someone who doesn't have a famous name but has consistent work in theater or film or TV - it has become harder to get through, harder to raise a family.
author: Annette Bening

quote: I'm supposed to be famous, but I don't think I like it so much.
author: Caster Semenya

quote: To me, I can be famous in sports. But to me, I cannot say it means a lot to be famous. Being famous is something I don't like.
author: Caster Semenya

quote: Whenever I'm in theatre situations I will go out of my way not to talk about my father, but in the film world I can be really proud of my family and say, 'You know what: my dad's a really, really famous theatre director,' because nobody has any idea.
author: Rebecca Hall

quote: If I got too famous, I'd just quit acting, but I think it's highly unlikely I'm going to get really famous.
author: Rebecca Hall

quote: I've had to deal, a lot, with my own sense of intimidation at meeting famous people - especially actors, but really any famous people.
author: Charlie Kaufman

quote: The Kardashians can be famous for being famous. What do they do? I can't figure it out.
author: Larry King

quote: It was never in my mind to be famous.
author: Francois Nars

quote: I've always been quite famous for my nose.
author: Darcey Bussell

quote: Air travelers, of course, are famous for their hubris. They carry on too many bags and use the restroom when the seat-belt sign is on.
author: Meghan Daum

quote: The search for happiness has long been a dominant feature of American life. It's a byproduct of prosperity, not to mention the most famous line in the Declaration of Independence.
author: Meghan Daum

quote: I'm not a fan of the working class being mocked, including by some of our famous writers - even those who came from it.
author: Melvyn Bragg

quote: Part of me wants to stay involved in wrestling, because I love it. But the thing I loved most about it was the wrestling part of it. I didn't get into it to be famous or to be a TV star: I got into it because I loved the act of wrestling.
author: Daniel Bryan

quote: If you want to be famous because you do something well or badly, be it singing while fat or hitting balls of various shapes and hues, you have to be prepared to divulge. We live in the age of the chronic overshare.
author: Alexandra Petri

quote: Henry Miller is a famous writer whose work has fallen out of fashion, but I strongly recommend that readers who don't know his work pick up a book and experience this writer's zealous, crazy, inventive, funny, sexy, often delirious prose.
author: Siri Hustvedt

quote: Nikola Tesla, one of Colorado's famous residents, always believed that the gasoline engine made no sense.
author: Kimbal Musk

quote: It is difficult to be famous and that successful where you can't even walk down the street without people chasing you, and having people build monuments to you and worshiping you - all that stuff - but I never took that to a place where I believed it. I saw it as being temporary and a phase.
author: David Cassidy

quote: What happened to me during the last couple of years of 'The Partridge Family' was I became so famous and so isolated and so unhappy that I had to do anything I could to end it.
author: David Cassidy

quote: 'The Admirable Crichton' is probably Barrie's most famous work after 'Peter Pan', nearly a pendant to that classic.
author: Michael Dirda

quote: How did females become 'guys?' How did everyone become 'guys?' Remember, too, that a male guy was something of a scoundrel. And a wise guy was a fresh kid, a whippersnapper. In its most other famous evocation, men in Brooklyn said 'youse guys.' Damon Runyon referred to hustlers, gamblers, and other nefarious types as guys.
author: Frank Deford

quote: All sorts of famous sports people have been suspended for extended periods.
author: Frank Deford

quote: No matter what you achieve, what you want to aspire to be, or how famous and powerful you become, the most important thing is whether you are excited about each and every moment of your life because of your work and people around you.
author: Sushant Singh Rajput

quote: Fact is, famous people say fame stinks because they love it so - like a secret restaurant or holiday island they don't want the hoi polloi to get their grubby paws on.
author: Julie Burchill

quote: Never, never have a famous partner. It's too complicated.
author: Robyn Davidson

quote: I can deal with it now, but 13 is a tough age to be recognized and famous. It's a tough age, period.
author: Bill Skarsgard

quote: I was a guy who wanted to become famous. There was steam coming out of my ears, I wanted to be famous so badly. You want the attention, you want the bucks, and you want the best seat in the restaurant. I didn't think what the repercussions would be.
author: Matthew Perry

quote: If I hadn't had the experience of being famous, I would have searched for it my whole life. I would have just gone on and on trying to find it.
author: Matthew Perry

quote: Don't call me famous, but it's hard to be out with my friends now.
author: Katie Taylor

quote: When I was 20, I wanted to be famous and win a Grammy and have people respect and love me.
author: Andra Day

quote: 'The Narrow Road to the Deep North' is one of the most famous books of all Japanese literature, written by the great poet Basho in 1689.
author: Richard Flanagan

quote: I became very famous, as a teenager, and my name and photo were splashed in all the media. They made me larger than life, so I wanted to live larger than life, and the only way to do that was to be intoxicated.
author: Cat Stevens

quote: I was a grown-up when 'celebrity' happened. So I knew exactly what it was like to be in line at a restaurant and watch someone famous walk in and get a table immediately. I knew I didn't like that; I don't want to make somebody else feel the way I felt.
author: Judy Sheindlin

quote: In terms of being a famous person, it hasn't changed anything. It's not important for me.
author: Lizzie Armitstead

quote: There's a famous saying: 'Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned.' I want to change it to 'Hell hath no fury like a nation scorned.'
author: Adnan Sami

quote: In 'A Few Best Men,' I play a lesbian character. I played the lesbian sister of the bride who ends up kissing a dude at the end, but she was, like, a full-on lesbian in that. And I beat out famous Australian lesbians for the role.
author: Rebel Wilson

quote: The one thing I've always done as an author is talk to my publicists. Because they have all the best stories - and they have all the dirt on other, more famous and important writers. They're not supposed to talk about it, but sometimes you can get awesome little tidbits from them.
author: Lynn Coady

quote: Everybody just wants to be famous first, and then maybe learn how to act.
author: Dennis Quaid

quote: I don't think you can decide how famous or not you become.
author: Rupert Friend

quote: Hollywood's famous for putting you in a box.
author: Mickey Rourke

quote: I find that my entire life has come to me, and things happened without me planning them. You know, I never asked to photograph Princess Diana, and that made me more famous than I wanted. I never asked to photograph Madonna, and that pushed me to another level. There are things that just take you into the limelight.
author: Mario Testino

quote: This whole celebrity racket, it's not really my bag. I don't really do that stuff, and I am not looking to get famous myself. I would love it if my characters get famous, my work was well known and appreciated. But I'm an actor, not a spokes model or a celebrity or whatever that is. I don't know how to be that.
author: John C. Reilly

quote: I'm way too famous and rich to be on a dating app, but if I get very desperate by the time I'm 60, I'll go on Tinder. Or I'll go on 'Millionaire Matchmaker'; I'll call Patti Stanger.
author: Lisa Lampanelli

quote: I guess a show like 'Entourage' would be wish fulfillment, right? But 'Entourage' is wish fulfillment for men. It's that you can be kind of schlumpy-looking and have access to someone famous and find yourself at a pool party surrounded by girls in bikinis.
author: Jill Soloway

quote: To my surprise, the more I searched about Qi Xiangfu, the more I found of a life lived partly online. He once wrote a short memoir in which he described himself in the third person, with the formality usually reserved for China's most famous writers.
author: Evan Osnos

quote: I am still moved by passages of Marx: the 'Critique of Hegel's Philosophy of Right,' for example, where, after the famous line about religion being 'the opium of the people,' he goes on to call it 'the heart of a heartless world.'
author: Geoff Dyer

quote: For a while, I became a model scout and agent, thinking naively I could change the industry from the inside, and even kicked off the famous 'size zero debate' with an article I wrote to the 'Evening Standard' about my concerns from behind the curtain of the business, back in 2005.
author: Jameela Jamil

quote: My most famous show is the 'Kitchen Show.' More famous than any gallery show or museum show I curated.
author: Hans-Ulrich Obrist

quote: The famous pilot season literally sends shivers down my spine.
author: Lily James

quote: I don't have many famous friends, really, except Simon Cowell.
author: Leona Lewis

quote: Usually when I see someone famous, for some reason, I think I know them.
author: Leona Lewis

quote: There's a tendency, when the offspring of a famous person does something notable, to define them by their more-famous parent.
author: Rachel Sklar

quote: I knew what I was getting into when I chose golf. Hell, I knew I'd never get rich and famous. All the discrimination, the not being able to play where I deserved and wanted to play - in the end, I didn't give a damn. I was made for a tough life because I'm a tough man. And in the end, I won: I got a lot of black people playing golf.
author: Charlie Sifford

quote: I'm really, really interested in the job of acting. I can really care less about being famous. I'm more about the work, and 'The Big C' was amazing, so I wanted to be a part of it.
author: Gabourey Sidibe

quote: I didn't want to be an actress at all, or famous even. I certainly enjoy acting now, absolutely. Time will tell whether or not I enjoy fame.
author: Gabourey Sidibe

quote: I have this famous joke that I use: Why was God able to create Heaven and Earth in seven days and seven nights? Because he didn't have installed customers and legacy technology to worry about.
author: Brad D. Smith

quote: It's really easy to avoid the tabloids. You just live your life and don't hang out with famous people who are in the tabloids. Don't do anything controversial and be a normal person. Have friends. And get a job and keep working.
author: Amanda Seyfried

quote: I never, ever see myself as a celebrity or famous, so I poke fun at that.
author: Kendra Wilkinson

quote: I never, ever see myself as a celebrity or famous.
author: Kendra Wilkinson

quote: I'm more of a homebody type. I don't want to look like I want to be in the public eye. I didn't become an actress to be famous.
author: Sarah Hyland

quote: I want to be famous everywhere.
author: Luciano Pavarotti

quote: In opera, as with any performing art, to be in great demand and to command high fees you must be good of course, but you must also be famous. The two are different things.
author: Luciano Pavarotti

quote: I've only ever wanted to be a singer; I never wanted to be famous.
author: Katherine Jenkins

quote: My favourite Korean food is delicious black five-layered pork belly, cooked over a charcoal grill. And Jeju chocolate, in citrus fruits and green tea flavour, which is famous throughout Korea.
author: Lee Hyeon-seo

quote: I don't want to be movie-star famous. I want to move people with my writing.
author: Ethan Canin

quote: With high fashion, it's a performance. You're trying to interpret a fantasy in a very physical way, and you really are playing a character. I've played men, dead people, famous people, historical icons, and it's no mean feat. It's quite an insular experience even though the crowd is in front of you and there's an expectation.
author: Erin O'Connor

quote: Although I was born to famous parents, I know and feel the problems of ordinary citizens.
author: Benigno Aquino III

quote: One thing about D.C. that's funny to me is that you end up running into famous political figures who you've seen on television who you think are not real until you see them.
author: Maz Jobrani

quote: I am not famous at all.
author: Sam Taylor-Johnson

quote: Look at Jessica Simpson. She's famous for being dumb. I guess it started with Marylyn Monroe, and she actually wasn't that dumb, but that's how she was perceived - and that's what got popular.
author: Danica McKellar

quote: One of the strengths of the DC Universe has been the strength of the rogues' gallery. Often times they're as famous - if not more infamous - than our heroes.
author: Jim Lee

quote: The Famous Amos Chocolate Chip Cookie was an unexpected, unplanned pop culture phenomena. My father went from star-maker to star.
author: Shawn Amos

quote: My father's very public life as Famous Amos was the opposite of that of his ex-wife, my mother Shirley, who was fighting a very private, solitary battle with mental illness.
author: Shawn Amos

quote: While not a musician, my father was a music agent for years before becoming pop culture icon Famous Amos.
author: Shawn Amos

quote: Of course, screwed up families are not the exclusive province of the famous. Still, most families get to screw up in private.
author: Shawn Amos

quote: 'Strictly' is a bit like scoring the winning goal in the FA Cup Final or sinking the final putt in the Ryder Cup - only a few people get the opportunity to do it, and they have got to be famous.
author: Anton du Beke

quote: Having been part of this wonderful show ever since series one, I know all too well what it's like to perform to the nation on the famous 'Strictly Come Dancing' dancefloor.
author: Anton du Beke

quote: It's funny - nowadays people that are famous get chased by paparazzi. They have this fame, but they don't have the money to hide from it.
author: Matt LeBlanc

quote: Jesus of Nazareth was the most famous human being who ever lived on this planet, and he had no infrastructure, and it's never been done. He had no government, no PR guy, no money, no structure. He had nothing, yet he became the most famous human being ever.
author: Bill O'Reilly

quote: I am not hugely famous; I am not a name. For me, it's not the size of the role, it's the material and the people you are working with.
author: Ruth Negga

quote: Being famous is not something that would make me feel successful - unless one was striving for mediocrity.
author: William Hurt

quote: Being a famous actress may give you a sense of being important, but believe me, it's just an illusion.
author: Juliette Binoche

quote: It's never been my purpose to become an American icon, or more famous or richer.
author: Juliette Binoche

quote: Anytime you cast a movie and you need someone famous in the lead part, you're a prisoner of whoever happens to be famous in the six-month window in which you're trying to get a film financed.
author: Alexander Payne

quote: Ever since grammar school, I knew I wanted to be famous - I always wanted to be a singer.
author: Jennifer Hudson

quote: These days, with 'American Idol' and all the other reality shows, young people become famous overnight, and that can be very difficult to handle, the way photographers follow you around and study your every move.
author: Barry Manilow

quote: I'm not in the business of becoming famous. And that's the advice I give to younger aspiring actors. Work onstage and do the little roles. In the end it's not important to be seen. It's important to do. There's a lot of disappointment in this business, but my family keeps me grounded.
author: Kristen Bell

quote: It's weird to have people so interested in your personal life. It's a part of the business that grosses me out. I'm always bummed out for people who just happen to be dating a celebrity, and they're also famous, and they can't live their life.
author: Andy Samberg

quote: I never wanted to be famous. It was amusing at first, but now I hate it. I just wanted to be respected by people I respect. And I wanted to be rich. It's best to get rich, then you can do what you want.
author: Caitlin Moran

quote: I hate that tabloid idea of anybody who is famous having to forfeit their privacy.
author: Caitlin Moran

quote: When people say that George Harrison made me famous, that is true in a way.
author: Ravi Shankar

quote: I have my own spiritual guru, and I'm so happy, and I feel so satisfied that I might appreciate many other famous gurus, but, you know, I am not attracted that way because I have found the person.
author: Ravi Shankar

quote: I pride myself in being an aficionado of the British seaside. Throughout my career, I have visited and worked in many of the famous British resorts, from Great Yarmouth to Largs.
author: Martin Parr

quote: Look at the news stand, you know? I mean, it's a cacophony of famous people or people who want to be famous with blurbs all around it, and it's supposed to be, you know, that's supposed to be creativity in journalism. My God, it's unbelievable. It's shocking.
author: George Lois

quote: I didn't necessarily want to be famous growing up, but I knew I would be a good famous person because I'm not offended if somebody comes up to me and knows things about me and wants to engage me in a conversation.
author: Nate Berkus

quote: I didn't grow up thinking I'd be a decorator. Design is my greatest passion, and it naturally just pulled me down the path. Same with TV. Being famous or having a show was never the motivation. I got a call and was swept up by the challenge of that first small space redesign.
author: Nate Berkus

quote: Now, we believe that the majority of teachers in America know our system must be reformed, to put students first so that America can compete, that teachers don't teach to become rich or famous. They teach because they love children.
author: Chris Christie

quote: Because I think in order to get famous you have to be known for something. Like 'You're the romantic comedy girl' or 'You're the Oscar-winning whatever girl.'
author: Rachel Weisz

quote: I was there when the quote-unquote golden age of musical theater was flourishing. I met everybody who worked in theater or was famous in theater from the '40s on.
author: Harold Prince

quote: It's great - that's the best part about being famous is that people want to get to know me. People come up to me and introduce themselves, and I make friends, and then I meet their friends. It seems like I have a very happy and comfortable social life, which is something I never had when I was younger.
author: Rivers Cuomo

quote: I'm really in no danger of being perceived as a famous movie actor!
author: Lyle Lovett

quote: I'm a big soccer fan, so any soccer player that I meet, I always get star struck. I've met a lot of big stars - Justin Timberlake, Michael Buble - and I don't ever get starstruck, but when I met famous ex-football players, I just got completely starstruck.
author: Olly Murs

quote: I've always looked at famous actors and hope that once they get a part that they have success in, they would reprise it every few years in the way a pop singer will reprise their hits. Like Bob Dylan singing 'Blowin' in the Wind' until he's fed up with it, finding different ways of doing it.
author: Mark Rylance

quote: I don't think I'd want to be a comedian today if I saw it on the telly. I wouldn't think it was a thing for weirdoes and drop-outs; I'd think it was a thing for squares who wanted to be famous.
author: Stewart Lee

quote: Stardom can be a gilded slavery.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: When I was a kid, I would come home from school, and my mom would buy the industrial-size Famous Amos cookies or Chips Ahoy when I was lucky. And I would sit in front of the TV set with a glass of milk... and I would dump cookies in there, smash them with my spoon, and eat cookies and milk with a spoon watching 'The Dukes of Hazzard.'
author: Johnny Iuzzini

quote: I know really, really famous people who are terrified every time they walk on to a stage.
author: Bill Nighy

quote: I'm not famous for my back story investigations; I'm lucky that I work with good writers and it's usually in the script.
author: Bill Nighy

quote: When I first got famous in the '60s, I got a little too famous, and in order to escape showbusiness, I moved to Hawaii.
author: Buffy Sainte-Marie

quote: I wanted to sing when I was little. That's what I liked doing. It didn't occur to me that you became famous or anything like that.
author: Linda Ronstadt

quote: I didn't think I was a famous singer. I didn't think I was a star or that I could make the waters part - just that singing was what I was going to do.
author: Linda Ronstadt

quote: We're living in a time when the most famous people in the world have no specific skill set and are known for living their lives in front of the world. How strange is that? The appeal makes sense to me - it's like 'The Truman Show,' getting a chance to peak into someone's bedroom or see the way someone fights with their husband.
author: Erin Foster

quote: When I did stand-up at U.C.B., and I had a blog for a couple of years that started my writing career, 'Totally Confident and Completely Insecure,' it was the same kind of self-deprecating humor and stories about being out in L.A. and being treated like a loser at a hair salon because you are not famous.
author: Erin Foster

quote: Anyone who is on the verge of kind of famous but not really relevant is kind of fun to play with.
author: Erin Foster

quote: With 'Barely Famous', we've tapped into and created something really exciting that we'll always be proud of going forward.
author: Erin Foster

quote: You don't get to be in the squad unless you're six feet tall, a supermodel, perfect, famous, and hot. That's like hand selecting perfection, putting it into a group of girls, and saying, 'Look how amazing we are.'
author: Erin Foster

quote: Some people can't sing - like honestly - but they're famous anyway, and they might be famous for being an artist, which is completely different from being a singer.
author: Zara Larsson

quote: It is more interesting to be compared to someone famous, because it lets you gauge what perceptions people have about your appearance.
author: Arthur Smith

quote: There's always going to be that pressure when you're in front of the camera. When you're famous it's just an extreme version of reality and there's a pressure to look a certain way.
author: Geri Halliwell

quote: At first, I thoroughly enjoyed being famous.
author: Phil Donahue

quote: Oprah was famous for going to a garden party and ad-libbing. She could literally interview people for a half hour about nothing, and it was entertaining. She had her own show before she had her own show.
author: John Tesh

quote: My mum lives in Boston; she's famous for teaching wushu and t'ai chi. So from when I was young, my mum and aunt were like: 'You're training; you're not playing baseball or football.' Training every day was normal. Later, when I was almost a teenager, Bruce Lee became my idol.
author: Donnie Yen

quote: When you're famous, you're always famous. It doesn't go away.
author: Bob Saget

quote: I think anybody who's famous has to deal with their fame in their own way, and I dealt with it by making a film about a kid who's looking out into the world of celebrity obsession.
author: Adrian Grenier

quote: People get a little sidelined thinking that fame and fortune is going to bring them happiness, peace and contentment in their lives. Everyone thinks they want to be famous until the paparazzi are in their face, and then they're asking, 'Just give me some privacy.'
author: Linda Thompson

quote: The advantage of taking pictures of the famous is that they get published.
author: Elliott Erwitt

quote: First of all, plain and simple, you have no real idea of what it means to be famous until you become famous. It's a double-edged sword. Obviously there are a lot of amazing things about fame, but there are also a lot of challenging things about it.
author: Michelle Pfeiffer

quote: I married a pretty famous girl, and when we drive through town there's usually a car following us, when I walk out of my front door in Chelsea there's six guys waiting for me.
author: Kevin Pietersen

quote: My wife Elizabeth and I started The Really Terrible Orchestra for people like us who are pretty hopeless musicians who would like to play in an orchestra. It has been a great success. We give performances; we've become the most famous bad orchestra in the world.
author: Alexander McCall Smith

quote: You don't have to have an attitude if you're famous.
author: Adriana Lima

quote: When I'm living in the world of luxury and celebrity, which is where I found myself for a large part of my life, it's a walk-on part. Not a vital necessity, like it is for so many people. I enjoy it but I can see right through it!
author: Agnetha Faltskog

quote: I had a flight trainer who is one of the biggest and most famous helicopter pilots the world.
author: Izabella Scorupco

quote: In American military cemeteries all over the world, seemingly endless rows of whitened grave markers stand largely unvisited and in silence. The gardeners tend the lawns, one section at a time. Even at the famous sites, tourism is inconstant.
author: Mark Helprin

quote: Fame - anyone who says he doesn't like it is crazy.
author: Bennett Cerf

quote: I could have been more famous if I did all the glitzy things, but celebrity always seemed so unnecessary.
author: Enya

quote: I really hate the duties of being a celebrity, like getting dressed up for the red carpet.
author: America Ferrera

quote: I can't imagine wanting to be famous just for the sake of being famous. I think fame should come along with success, talent.
author: Kat Dennings

quote: I was always obsessed with being famous. I had Marilyn Monroe paper dolls as a child, and I was always obsessed with her. I've just been really driven in that direction, and none of my friends were. So, I don't know what put that bug in me at a young age.
author: Holly Madison

quote: Quentin is very organic; there was no way that he was going to put someone else's hand in there and anyway, my hands are kind of famous. It seemed right.
author: David Carradine

quote: Being in 'Us Weekly' does not make you famous.
author: Bradley Cooper

quote: Save your rejections so that later when you are famous you can show them to people and laugh.
author: Meg Cabot

quote: I've worked with a lot of people who are more famous than myself who are terribly insecure.
author: Barry Gibb

quote: Even when she was alive, Esther Kreitman's novels, short stories and translations received far less attention than the work of her famous brothers, I. J. and Isaac Bashevis Singer.
author: Clive Sinclair

quote: Normal is such a hard word to use, because everyone's idea of normal is different. Real is what the word is. I think you either live a real life or you live a weird celebrity pseudolife. I think I lead a really real life.
author: Sarah Michelle Gellar

quote: Being big and famous doesn't get you more freedom, it gets you less.
author: Robert Wyatt

quote: Celebrity gives us delusion of self importance.
author: Al Goldstein

quote: My favorite thing about being famous... it's not really as big of a deal as everybody says it is. Being on the road is tough, doing interviews, and all the stuff. It's still pretty tough.
author: Aaron Carter

quote: When you're as famous as I am, stories take on a life of their own.
author: Norman Wisdom

quote: I don't do the whole, 'Put my name on it, make me famous' thing.
author: T-Pain

quote: Rich and famous is not bad, but poor and famous sucks.
author: Paul Hogan

quote: Celebrity is the advantage of being known to people who we don't know, and who don't know us.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

quote: I don't feel famous.
author: Uma Thurman

quote: I'm much more famous than I am rich, but I'm able to scale back my lifestyle. I know a lot of people who were where I was who can't imagine living any simpler, but I haven't got a lot of expensive wants.
author: Ali MacGraw

quote: I never feel so utterly fraudulent as when I review a movie whose charms impress all in the world and I simply do not get it. The other variant is that I love something the world disdains. This has had severe career consequences: I am still famous - or notorious - in certain quarters where I am recalled as the man who liked 'Hudson Hawk.'
author: Stephen Hunter

quote: It's not my goal to be a famous actor.
author: Gavin DeGraw

quote: I served the famous professors and scholars, and eventually they learned that the Reverend Moon is superior to them. Even Nobel laureate academics who thought they were at the center of knowledge are as nothing in front of me.
author: Sun Myung Moon

quote: I am beautiful, famous and gorgeous.
author: Anna Kournikova

quote: Here's the funny thing about the response I've been aware of to my dating famous people: It's been very negative. I'm either not good-looking enough, not a good enough actor or not successful enough for these people.
author: Dax Shepard

quote: I put my money in the bank: I have to think of life after modeling, when I'm not famous any more.
author: Eva Herzigova

quote: My story of success and failure is not just about music and being famous. It's about living and loving and trying to find purpose in this crazy world.
author: Wynonna Judd

quote: I knew a lot of girls who just wanted to be famous, and if that's your goal, that's awesome; that just wasn't enough for me.
author: Lizzo

quote: The international media concentrates on the famous, the big names. Al Jazeera goes to the margins, investigates stories that are still developing and in the future become very big. Why did the Arabic world love Al Jazeera? Everybody felt he was represented in the newsroom and on the screen. That kind of belonging is ours.
author: Wadah Khanfar

quote: It's too late for me to get married before I'm famous. You never know people's intentions.
author: Carmelo Anthony

quote: There is no celebrity quite as powerful as the local, homegrown celebrity.
author: Tony Wilson

quote: I'm not the guy that wants to be famous and make loads of money and sell loads of records. I don't want that. I just want to be true. I want to be... I want to serve music. I want to be honest.
author: Damien Rice

quote: I never set out to become 'famous.' I mean, when you're 14 you think 'I'm gonna become a writer and people will want my autograph and that'll be cool,' but you grow up and you learn that's just not how the world works. I resigned myself to the fact that I would probably never be published and if I did it probably wouldn't be a big deal.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

quote: Celebrity, to me, is not a thing to seek.
author: Aidan Quinn

quote: Disinterring famous people has become a kind of sport in the Hispanic world. Before Cervantes, it happened to Evita, Che Guevara, Federico Garcia Lorca, and Pablo Neruda.
author: Ilan Stavans

quote: I can't see any value in being a celebrity, famous for being famous.
author: Noomi Rapace

quote: It's not a matter of becoming a superstar. Fame and money aren't the purpose of all this. No actor's going to say, 'I don't want to be famous.' But the main purpose for doing what I'm doing is the passion in the work.
author: Christopher Lambert

quote: Fame, I have already. Now I need the money.
author: Wilhelm Steinitz

quote: I do dead Canadians. If he's dead and he's Canadian and he's famous, I'll be playing him at some point.
author: Colm Feore

quote: You can get awful famous in this country in seven days.
author: Gary Hart

quote: Indeed, wretched the man whose fame makes his misfortunes famous.
author: Lucius Accius
